title: Big Mo

properties.value: Big Mo was a travelling sales and businessman supposedly from Zeah[1] who visited the mainland for a period of 30 days. He was located in a random location each day, and was only available during May 2015. Once per day during May 2015, he offered players a clue scroll for 50 coins. The tier of clue scroll was random each day.

content:
Big Mo was removed after an update.
As the contents of this page no longer exist in Old School RuneScape, this article is preserved for historical purposes.
"Mo" redirects here. For his younger brother, see Little Mo.
Big Mo
Released30 April 2015 (Update)
Removal18 June 2015 (Update)
MembersYes
RaceHuman
LocationSee locations, Realm of Memories
Sells itemsYes

ExamineWould you buy a used magic carpet from this man?
Advanced data
NPC IDremoved

Big Mo was a travelling sales and businessman supposedly from Zeah[1] who visited the mainland for a period of 30 days. He was located in a random location each day, and was only available during May 2015. Once per day during May 2015, he offered players a clue scroll for 50 coins. The tier of clue scroll was random each day.

Each day at midnight (00:00) GMT, Big Mo moved to a new location. His location was hinted by the official Old School RuneScape Twitter feed.

A total of 104,405 players spoke to Mo, 88,527 of whom bought 1 clue. 46,968 players bought 4 or more clues and only a total of 1,700 players bought a clue every single day during the event.

He made a reappearance in the Realm of Memories during the 20th Anniversary event.

Contents

  • 2 Dialogue
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 See also

Locations[edit | edit source]

Date Twitter hint Location
31 May Something, something, something... Dark side. Something, something, something... Cult. Near the Clock Tower, south-west of East Ardougne.
30 May Amazeing. At the north-western section of the Tree Gnome Village maze.
(Enter from the south-eastern corner. Easy access from the Nightmare Zone minigame teleport.)
29 May N/A At the Chaos Altar, south-east of Varrock, directly south of Aubury.
28 May N/A On the top floor of the Wizards' Tower, next to Wizard Mizgog.
27 May N/A At Evil Dave's basement, west of Edgeville bank.
26 May They can't be assisting in much engineering if they just stand around all day holding boxes. Next to the entrance of the Dwarven mines by the Ice Mountain, north of Falador.
25 May A bowl of stew for only 20 coins? Bargain. Inside Seers' Village pub, west of the bank.
24 May N/A Inside Galahad's house, east of the Coal Trucks, west of McGrubor's Wood.
23 May N/A Outside the Wizards' Guild in Yanille.
22 May This place is horrid! So dark, dingy... And it stinks of fish, too. Inside the Goblin Cave, near the Fishing Guild.
21 May There's nothing like getting out into nature when on holiday. Unless that nature explodes. That is the bad sort of nature. Outside the Red chinchompa hunting ground, south-west of Feldip Hills. (Fairy ring AKS)
20 May It can't be comfortable in there... He is taller than the pillars! Just an extra incentive for Big Mo to avoid legal troubles. Outside the Seers' Village Courthouse.
19 May Maybe if she would stop nagging he would stop wagging his chin. At the Observatory Dungeon, north of Castle Wars.
18 May Making reading fun. And expensive. 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Lighthouse, north of the Barbarian Outpost (Horror from the Deep required; he will not appear in the lighthouse during the quest)
17 May N/A At the picnic area outside the Shadow Dungeon, north-west of the Fishing Guild
16 May All of this lava without a single warning sign? You'd better pray no one falls in. At the Chaos Altar near Red salamanders, north of Castle Wars, west of the Battlefield
15 May King Healthorg doesn't look quite so great stood next to Big Mo. Outside the gates of Tree Gnome Stronghold
14 May Perhaps Big Mo was in need of a newcomer map? At the docks of Catherby
13 May There is gnome way they are winning. South-east section of the Khazard Battlefield, west of the Ardougne Monastery
12 May Don't just do something! Stand there! Next to Captain Lawgof at the Coal Trucks, north-west of the Fishing Guild (Ardougne)
11 May For a town with so much crime you would think that the docks would have more security. At the docks, near Captain Barnaby, south of East Ardougne
10 May You need to have a defence level of 20 to equip this gate. Outside the entrance of the Legends' Guild north-east of East Ardougne (Fairy Ring BLR)
9 May Looks like Big Mo is interested in a stabbie chucker. It is not for freeness, though. At Rantz, east of the Feldip Hills (Fairy Ring AKS)
8 May A pick-lock option on a coffin? How very dark. At Jiggig entrance, south of Castle Wars (Zogre Flesh Eaters not required)
7 May This is definitely not the place for a man of Big Mo's size. Maybe he could help fend off the wolves, though. At the bar inside the passage under White Wolf Mountain (Fishing Contest required)
6 May It seems Big Mo is trying to get his hands on a rare sort of egg. He'll have a job getting one out of that place. Inside the Barbarian Assault minigame building at the Barbarian Outpost
5 May Just north of Ash, lad! Inside the Rellekka Longhall Bar in the centre of Rellekka
4 May Do people from these parts always take their platelegs off for a brew? Inside the Fight Arena Bar in the south-western corner of the Fight Arena
3 May Travel is tiring. If only benches were made to fit a man of Mo's size. North of Jatix's Herblore Shop in Taverley
2 May Rajj has kept him waiting for quite some time now. Top floor in Al Kharid Palace
1 May N/A Varrock Square

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 April 2015
(update)

Throughout May you might find yourself bumping into Big Mo. Big Mo is a businessman and salesman from overseas who has decided to take a trip around the map between May 1st and May 31st in an effort to get his hands on some interesting and valuable wares.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Big Mo mentions he is from a distant land beyond Karamja. Zeah was later released, but in the Realm of Memories he says he "may or may not" be from Zeah and deliberately leaves his origin ambiguous.
  • Big Mo has a younger brother, Little Mo.
  • The 31st of May clue is a reference to a Star Wars joke from the series Family Guy, in which Emperor Palpatine says something similar as his way to create great Star Wars dialogue.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Little Mo

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 26 July 2016. (Archived from the original on 27 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "That was what we intended, though there's no-one on Zeah who actually looks anything like him."
